page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: The principle means of transport is by car, bus and train. Relatively few people (mainly school pupils) use bicycles. {RAILWAY}- 687 trains pass through the area in 24 hours on a weekday, and 297 stop at Shenfield Station showing its importance as a commuting centre and railway junction. On a weekday 6700 passengers join trains at Shenfield; Of these 3300 join 40 trains departing to London between 0700 and 1000 hours. 3000 alight from 35 trains from London between 1600 and 1900. {ROADS}- Because of the great amount of commuting the road network is under great pressure at peak hours despite the town's northern by-pass (A12) and the recently opened M25. The intensity of peak tidal flow is high and even off-peak residual traffic is considerable.
